0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Tinea, Superficial: apply TOPICAL preparations to affected areas of skin twice daily

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Tinea, Superficial: 2 y and older, apply TOPICAL preparations to affected areas of skin twice daily

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Tinea, Superficial
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Onychomycosis due to dermatophyte

2.title: Pregnancy Category
2.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

3.title: Breast Feeding
3.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Topical: Fungicidal; exact mechanism unknown; however, it has been reported to distort the hyphae and to stunt mycelial growth in susceptible organisms.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
  • wash and dry the affected areas before application
  • (cream) apply a thin layer to the affected area
  • (powder aerosol) applied liberally to affected areas from a distance of 6 to 10 inches
  • (liquid aerosol) applied liberally to affected areas from a distance of 6 to 10 inches
  • (powder) apply liberal quantities of powder to the affected areas; also applied to socks and shoes when treating foot infections

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause contact dermatitis and irritation.
  • Instruct patient to tell healthcare professional if condition does not improve or gets worse after one week of therapy.
  • Advise patient to wash and dry affected area before applying drug.
  • Instruct patient not to apply other medicines to affected skin areas unless prescribed by healthcare professional.
  • Patient should not apply cosmetics or other skin products on treated skin areas.
